bibl.title: Literacy, Power, and the Transmitters of Early Christian Literature.
bibl.note: Diss. Univ. of North Carolina at Chapel Hill. Summary in DA 58 (1997-1998) p. 4693-A. - Who were the scribes that copied early Christian literature during the second and third centuries? And what role(s) did these scribes play in the (re)production, transmission, and interpretation of this literature?
HAINES-EITZEN Kim, Literacy, Power, and the Transmitters of Early Christian Literature.
